| MeshNumber = | DorlandsPre = c_56 | DorlandsSuf = 12260713 | }} The 'body
of the pancreas' is a subsection of the pancreas organ in the human body. It
is somewhat prismatic in shape, and has three surfaces: anterior, posterior,
and inferior.

It is at the same level as the transpyloric plane. BÃ¥lens
ytanatomi (surface anatomy). Godfried Roomans, Mats Hjortberg and Anca Dragomir.
Institution for Anatomy, Uppsala. 2008.
